p: Based on the previous studies of Asteraceae and Lamiaceae plant species, the number of plant species that exhibits diuretic effects is lesser than those other mechanisms, such as antioxidants, antihyperlipidemic, and vasorelaxant. The plant species that possess diuretic effect from the Asteraceae family are Chamaemelum nobile (L.) All. , Chrysanthemum x morifolium Ramat. Hemsl., and Tanacetum vulgare L. and the plant species from Lamiaceae family are Ajuga integrifolia Buch.-Ham. ex D. Don (syn. Ajuga remota Benth.) , Anisomeles indica (L.) Kuntze, and Plectranthus amboinicus (Lour) Spreng. The diuretic effect of C. nobile was assessed by examining the ratsâ€™ urine after fasted overnight ( Zeggwagh et al., 2009). After repeated oral administration of 140 mg/kg aqueous plant extract for three weeks, the extract showed a diuretic and hypotensive effect.
